Moved to General, since there's no actual gameplay question. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I seem to always get a crash right as a jet gets near some distant contract target, it is the most frustrating thing ever. Seems to be a result of repeatedly and rapidly switching back and forth between map view and ship view, when I am trying to judge how close I am to the target area..

The screen will start flashing between blue and white horizon effects, and a blown up screen-sized flag image, and ground or smoke textures, then it usually freezes when I try to hit escape or the space center button.. And another 15 or 20 minutes of play down the drain. I've had that happen 4 or 5 times recently, I've started land every couple minutes so the game can autosave, just in case.
We've been wrong on orbital mechanics this entire time! Instead of ellipses, orbits are much more squiggly.

I think the worst glitch I've ever had (and had several times inceidentally) is that on occasion when using more than one Klaw on a ship, e.g. when klawing one ship and then using the klaw on that one to klaw a third ship, KSP throws a NullReferenceException when "packing" the vessel when I try to enter timewarp, causing the ship to fail to disable Physics and instead turn into a wiggly, noodley worm thing and undergo a constant ~1g acceleration that eventually throws it out of orbit.

The memory leaks. They are hands down the worst bug I've seen from KSP. It's worse than the linux mousewheel bug because we may be stuck with it for months. Squad is tweeting out vacation picks while their just released product contains a documented memory leak. That is shocking.

I really wish they fixed the target tracking on the Navball when flying around Kerbin. It's so annoying how it moves down low on the ball so you can't see precisely where the point is. I've stopped doing surface missions for that reason.

Yeah, that's what I'm seeing as well. I actually haven't had nearly as many glitches and physics hiccoughs in 1.x. For instance, previously, nearly every time I went to Mun, if I did my transfer burn so that my Ap was about 50km, I'd get about 3/4 of the way to Mun and suddenly the game would burps and I'd have no Mun encounter at all. Then most of the time it would burp again and when I got really close and I'd have the encounter again. That hasn't happened at all in 1.x.

However, crashes happen all the time, and usually seem related to the heat gauges on F10. If those things are active for any period of time, the game just suddenly dies. It's especially annoying when you've struggled to get an SSTO up high enough and now it's coasting to Ap with heat gauges in numerous places and flickering engines, and then POOF, no game. So I'm having to train myself to hit F10 to turn off the heat gauges as a prophylactic measure as part of my takeoff checklist. T, Z, space, F10.

The other main annoyance I have is that when I revert something to the SPH or VAB, most times no parts show up. To be able to add parts to the ship, I have to leave the SPH/VAB to the KSC view and come back. Dunno if this is a KSP thing or a mod thing, though.

What did you do to get such ee... orbit?

After the refuel operation, trying to take off, the plane sunk in the ground and suddenly exploded... That was very sad.

"F5 for Safety!"

As for me it was when I did my very first launch with a flea lander in the Kerbal Grasslands. Poor Jeb freaked out on his ladder and flew into the center of Kerbin never to be heard from again. I restarted the campaign immediately as I never thought I would need to F5 a flea launch from KSP...

Overall, 1.0 and the subsequent patches have been 100% stable on my rig. But I am the only person I think who actually plays completely vanilla stock KSP, so that's probably why...
Apparently, if you even look at the rover wheel tweakables, your brakes may or may not work. Disaster may ensue.
I played vanilla with only mechjeb for the tricky maneuvers I sucked at, I never had a glitch like that. btw, I recommend KIS, It's like KAS but much better and easier to use!

#1 Constant Crashes from memory leaks ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif). Had a plane saved in orbit that needed to be landed... (the last of my crew was on it) on re-entry game would fall on its face every single time :T

#2 Imaginary Terrain landing on Bop (or maybe it was Pol?) ... was approaching the ground, a couple KM from the ground WHAM Ship explodes in mid air from a collision with invisible terrain. Reloaded from an F5, WhAM roughly the same place. 3rd try, descended REALLY slow and managed to land.

#3 VAB went bonkers. Designed a fancy dancy rocket (quite a lot of time in it) did some undo/redo combination... couldnt click on parts properly... hit save on the ship - all buttons greyed out ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif) Closed KSP, loaded my ship and it was buggy as hell(wouldnt let me click anything, shows all parts out of the staging on the right (even though they were solid in the VAB), had to start from scratch again.

Ran into so many more glitches, unbalances etc... been playing KSP since almost the very start, never seen it this buggy... I hope squad has a good vacation and comes back going bonkers on polishing the game for a month or 3....
